Interview Descriptions: The interview process took half an hour to conduct an assessment on research and ask a few behavioral interview questions.  Then, make a schedule stating your availability to work on the project.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Administrative Assistant 3 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Two Interviews. First was a phone call with the facilities manager, second was an interview with the same facilities manager, one person from the Maintenance Dept, and the Senior Residential Director.
Interview Questions:
What motivated you to apply for this job and how does your past work history make you qualified for it? 

Tell us about your experience working in roles where there was direct customer contact? 

Please talk us through a situation you have experienced at work that caused a high level of stress. 

Please tell us about a time you implemented a process change in your work because you saw a need for it? 

How would your supervisor describe your organizational skills? How do you keep organized? 

Please tell us about a time you missed a deadline, how did you notice it and what did you do once you noticed it?

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with 4-5 people within the department sitting in. Upper management did all the talking in the interview and staff only answered a few questions. I felt they were trying to hire or promote someone internally, but needed to interview external candidates as part of the hiring process.
Interview Questions: How well do you meet deadlines?

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with two staff, recorded for others on the panel. Interview questions were sent a day in advance. I prepared for the interview 2 minute responses, but the interviewers felt mechanical and didn't allow for questions due to the time constraint. It felt cold.
Interview Questions: I was primarily asked behavioral questions

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Two official interviews with the direct supervisor first and then two others who interact frequently with the position. Followed by a final chat with the director of the specific department. Typical interview questions.
Interview Questions:
Why are you interested in this position?
What do you think you would struggle with most in this position?
How have your weaknesses/strengths complimented previous supervisors weaknesses/strengths?
How do you interact with difficult coworkers?

title: R&D Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Group interview. 5 engineers and electrical engineer and mechanical engineers. Plus manager. Ask behavior interview questions and broad questions. Thanks for reading. I enjoyed meeting with the group of people.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult job situation. How did you react?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Took a long time. Unclear what their expectations were. Very bureaucratic.  Recruiter did a good job of keeping me informed throughout the process. Last step was an onsite.  I ended up declining not in part due to the lengthy process. 0 negotiation on comp - have no space to update the comp.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself? 
Tell me about your experience managing multiple projects

title: Senior Editor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Stark and by the book with little personal connection. Lists of questions were obvious. Atmosphere was not friendly. Interviewed by a group and not individually. Questions were dull with obvious answers.
Interview Questions: Experience in publishing asked for samples

title: Work Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied on Handshake, they responded asking when I am available for an interview. I then confirmed a time, and we had an interview over Zoom that was about 25/30 minutes
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a disagreement with a coworker and how you resolved it

title: Research Laboratory Supervisor/Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had 1 call, 1 assignment, 2 3-hour long interviews with group members in which I was asked to do some tasks, and 3 calls with other people in the team.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my experience using various software including Microsoft Package. I was asked about my background and my career vision.

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of typical questions about why I wanted to work there and skills and experience I would bring to the role, as well as behavioral questions. It was a panel interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UC Berkeley?

title: Desktop Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Received an email from the team lead regarding scheduling an interview. Scheduled an interview and was interviewed by two students currently working in the team. Mainly behavioral questions asking about career goals, experience, teamwork, and there is a short portion at the end that asks for basic IT questions just to get a grasp of your understanding of things.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a caller who has a problem but you are about to clock out?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Two parts to the interview, an individual and group. The individual section you rotate between three or four panels that ask you questions on why you want to be an RA. The group section involves seeing how you work amongst a team and designing the perfect residential hall.
Interview Questions: What would you include in the perfect residential hall?

title: Talent Aquisition Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: They asked me normal interview questions and tried to get to know me and stuff. They asked why I'm interested in the role and my qualifications and teaching skills and such.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Thoughtful yet disjointed meetings. A single round had 3 one-hour long interviews over three days. Some scripted questions with no semblance of a grading rubric. A number of "culture fit" interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to deal with a demanding coworker/customer.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: The prof asked a few easy questions regarding the past experience and introduced ongoing projects at the school. Positive experience and not many hard technical questions. Good impression in general.
Interview Questions: Q: describe past research projects and papers.

title: SLC Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Got a take home exam and later was interviewed by SLC tutors. Take home exam was an hour and a half long and consisted of around a dozen questions. The interview was around an hour long.
Interview Questions: Can you explain how you did x on the take home assessment?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Basic behavioral questions and about my background in the Philippines before I moved to the United States. It was just an informal interview because I took the advanced Filipino class.
Interview Questions: How would you improve the online classroom setting?

title: HR Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: First you receive an Initial Interview Questionnaire with pretty basic questions. Then you go in for a panel interview with a lot of situational/behavioral questions. Lastly, you have an interview with the manager.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to troubleshoot between systems and noticed a problem.

title: Project Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (UC Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied on the website for the job I was then got called for 2 rounds of in-person interview.  The interview was with the direct supervisor and faculty member with who I was going to work with on various projects.
Interview Questions: Walkthrough experience and how it related to the job description.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Face to face interview. Got invitation a week after I submitted the application. Required a transcript and a description of classes taken. Deadline if one week before the classes started so submit application early.
Interview Questions: What is your past experience?

title: Youth Programs Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Initial email invitation to a phone interview with link to sign up for available dates & times. First phone interview. Then second round of phone interview. Final would be a video call.
Interview Questions: There is concern regarding the amount of screen time that students are being exposed to. What recommendations do you have regarding this?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online
I was emailed by the director of the research center. We set up a video call interview. Within a week I received an email stating that I had not been selected for the second interview.
Interview Questions: How my qualifications fit the role

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: I was asked minimal questions about my work ethic and schedule when I applied. I interviewed with the head of my library and mostly communicated via email with them. Super straightforward and easy.
Interview Questions: What does your schedule look like?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was cordial, and did not waste time asking irrelevant questions. The interview process seemed quite fair. I have taught at other University of California campuses and this interviewer was quite reasonable, similar to my experience at other U.C. campuses and their extension campuses.
Interview Questions: What have you taught before? Have you taught online (virtually) before?

title: Registrar Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and was contacted a few weeks later to have a preliminary phone interview. 

I spoke with the interviewer and was asked a basic set of questions (It seems UC Berkeley tends to ask the same general questions for multiple positions. This was the 2nd interview I had for the school (different position) and similar questions were asked almost word for word.

I was told the hiring process/interview process would be likely a little slow but should hear back on my status within a week or so.  I sent a thank you email to the interviewer after we talked

After 3.5 weeks of radio silence I reached back out to the person that conducted the interview to check on my application status. Within 2 hours I received a general rejection email letting me know my application was no longer being considered. I think they must have forgotten to send this out earlier. I heard nothing directly from the person I spoke with.

I wish I had better insight as to why or what skills I was lacking.
Interview Questions: Share a situation where you had to make and or implement a (non-personnel) decision that did not please everyone. How did you handle it, what was the outcome, and how did the effected parties feel?

title: Communication Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online. Was contacted directly by email from the manager about a written assessment via email. I submitted it and they said they would get back to me within 2 weeks about next steps. After not hearing back after 2 weeks I emailed them and they didn't respond at all.  A month later I get an automated rejection email from the system. 
So rude and unprofessional, they could've taken 5 seconds to acknowledge receipt of the assessment or email me saying they were going with another candidate. Discouraged from applying again.
Interview Questions: What background do you have, what interests you about the position, some scenario questions, salary expectations, etc

title: Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening followed by a panel hosted via Zoom. 1:1 interviews after that. Phone screenings were short, 30 to 45 ish minutes. Zoom sessions were an hour often with a panel of 3 or more.
Interview Questions: What technical experience or applications experience would help you in the role?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: A professor reached out to me and wanted video recording of statistical concepts from me. He sent 5 questions and asked me how I approach those questions. I prepared well for the questions and recorded myself and sent to him
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: A questionnaire was sent about two weeks after I applied. Two weeks after that, there was a panel interview via Zoom. There was a final one-on-one interview. After that, they checked my references. The follow week, they made an offer.
Interview Questions: What is your strategy for handling multiple deadlines and competing priorities? Can you give an example of a position in which you needed to do this?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: A talk about my research and then individual meetings with group members...Make sure you're familiar with the work of the group you're applying to and have thought ahead about why this would be a good fit.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions:
- The interview process takes anywhere between 4-6 months
- There is no HR involved, its the hiring manager that does the setup from the beginning, so expect no updates or usual information available or answered for you
- You wouldn't get a clear picture on the timelines, potential start dates, interview process, number of rounds etc
- Expect no responses to your email communications
- I was invited for an in-person interview and was completely kept in dark that it was a panel interview. It takes out the advantage of getting to know your team before hand and better prepare with relevant questions.
- Extremely unprofessional way of conducting interview 
- No common courtesy of updating you on the outcome despite investing so many months into the process
- If you are career oriented and if you seem like an achiever, you are automatically disqualified because the hiring team wants to do the bare minimum required to keep their jobs secure. KEEP AWAY!!
Interview Questions: None that matter. They bring a piece of paper and read from it. The questions dont pertain to the challenges or the way things work in real time.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview - everything is conducted by email. They look at courses you took and experiences you have had and make you an offer or not.  You are more likely to get an offer if you have already worked as a teaching assistant before.
Interview Questions: What courses have you taken? Have you taught before?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: My interviewer first contacted me for a phone screen. A week later, I was invited for the first in-person interview. Later I was invited for the second round in-person interview.
Interview Questions: Please describe this position in your own words

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was my potential advisor, and he assessed my communication skills and my knowledge level in my research field. He answered questions, and then he informed me about various administrative issues related to the admission process.  He was kind and friendly.
Interview Questions:
Why did you choose to pursue a Ph.D. at this particular institution?
What projects have you been working on lately, and what was their outcome?
Where would you like to direct your research in the future?
Why would you like to direct your research to this specific field?

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: After submitting an application, there was a 1 hour phone screening interview with two employees.  After that, there was a 1.5 hour onsite interview with a panel of three.
Interview Questions: What are your organizational skills?  How do you handle difficult clients/students?  What experience do you have planning events.  How would you convince someone who is volunteering from other departments to do their part of the work for a project you're leading.

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Standard academic job process. I had an informal chat with the head of the lab, and they arranged for me to visit the campus and give a seminar talk for the department. I then had one-on-one mini-interviews with 5-6 people PhD students, postdocs and two faculty members. Each interview lasted about 1 hour. No formal panel interview.  Offer made after my visit.
Interview Questions: What is your research about? What do you plan to do if you come here? What skills do you bring that are lacking in the department?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: 1 day in person interview w/ five different panels of 2 people each. Individual interview was conducted with all other candidates in the room, and we switch tables every 5 minutes. Then, group interview was conducted and we had to work together to create a plan for a hypothetical situation.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Each researcher is different. There was an internal listing circulated throughout UCB departments. Then, I applied via email. I interviewed with the researcher.  I was interviewed once with NO test. I know at least 3 others were interviewed.
Interview Questions: Relevant experience, skills, flexibility, work style, etc.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: They flew us out to interview (about 50 students) and we bonded with the next potential class as well as current students and professors. If you get an interview you basically just have to not mess up in order to get in.
Interview Questions: Why MCB?

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: It is a short 15 minute interview. The interviewers were really nice. They gave a description of general duties and expectations of the position and then asked pretty easy, mainly behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you had to balance many different and conflicting responsibilities.

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for the Department of Molecular and Cell Biology is standard for biology PhD programs. You spend a few days there schmoozing with professors, current students, and other prospective students and hope you made a good impression.
Interview Questions: They asked a lot about my prior research experience.

title: Technology Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: They will email you about interview sessions. The process is a one-on-one interview with two of the unit supervisors and then a small group interview with 3-4 people with small panel or leads and supervisors. The goal of the small interview is seeing your skills working with others, so make sure to take space and give space in conversation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a technology consultant

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Brief, two interviews; one with postdoc, one with PI. They were very easy to talk to and asked questions about previous experience, knowledge of science, coursework, etc. Overall straightforward interview process.
Interview Questions: What did you work on at _________ institution?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, being asked about research experience and visions in the research area. Feel respected by the interviewer. The HR is a great help as well. The US visa took a bit longer  time than expected though.
Interview Questions: What have you worked for?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Awesome process, the interviewer was really nice. The questions were hard though, I couldn't get any of the questions.The questions were hard though, I couldn't get any of the questions.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite google product?

title: HRIS Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and after a couple of days, I got a call from the HR team. He asked specific questions about projects experience. The questions were quite difficult and the phone interview took about 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: Did you have any experience to participate in a project?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Online application. GRE, Personal statement, CV, personal history statement (this part is confusing...), three recommendation letter, tofel if you are international student. No interview required. Get offer Mid of January.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by two people. I was asked about my previous experience and programs previously used (Microsoft Office, etc.). Otherwise they asked fairly standard questions and "what would you do if" situations.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in your previous workplace where things went wrong and how you handled it.

title: HR Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview scheduled with a recruiter and the recruiter called me almost 45 minutes after the scheduled time even after I emailed to confirm they had the right number and that I had the information correct. Since I was working at another time, I had to reschedule the interview. When the recruiter called me a second time, I felt rushed through the interview. A phone interview that normally takes about 30mins at least took 13 mins. I was shocked when I was scheduled for the next round of interviews. I then interviewed with a panel of 4 people, which is already nerve-wracking, but I have never interviewed with a panel as cold and disinterested as this group.
Interview Questions: Describe your HR Generalist experience

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Submitted App online and heard from a member of the team ~4 weeks later. Set up a phone interview for the following week and then never heard back after the interview despite followup. I find rejection more professional than no response at all. This experience makes me not want to work for the University.
Interview Questions: Asked me to walk them through my resume

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, then was contacted by the HR Department with an opportunity to interview. First was a phone interview, then an in person interview. This was then followed up with an offer letter and the on boarding process began shortly after.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you've had to work with a difficult client. How did you respond?

title: Visiting Graduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: It's a 20-min interview. I presented my background and research progress in15 min and answered couples of questions in the last  5 min from the professor. I sent a thank you letter after interview.
Interview Questions: What are you planning to do after joining the lab?

title: Economics Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: An online application was posted onto the Economics Department newsletter. Application included resume and cover letter, information about student major and why they are interested in the position. Subsequently I was invited for a video all interview with an Economics Department Advisor.
Interview Questions:
Why would you be a good peer advisor and why?
What would you tell a student if ____? (some class advising issue)

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: It was very informal. They asked me about my resume and achievements. Continue bringing in experienced outside talent. Focus on outdated technology. Recognize that the current company culture is a huge hurdle for attracting younger talent and for up-keeping employee morale. If the San Mateo office will remain, invest in it and understand that you are competing against companies with the most attractive cultures in the world. Continue making efforts to reduce the culture of fear and encourage a collaborative environment.
Interview Questions: Name a time you helped someone and went above and beyond.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: The process for finding RA positions are pretty informal and vary a lot depending on the PIs. If you have worked with a professor previously then you can pretty much just get funding if the professor has money to support you. The departments have funding email lists that send out crucial info regularly as well.
Interview Questions: No questions asked

title: BioE Meng Graduate Program Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: I got an email and was set up for a phone interview with an Alumni graduated recently from the program I was applying for. The phone interview was about 15-20 minutes. The questions were pretty standard.
Interview Questions: Besides academic and research factors, what else does Berkeley appeal to you?

title: Food Delivery Driver Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: one-hour interview with the manager. Schdeule via email. Found the listing on work-study job listing. Asked for referrals and provided them. Got an email saying I got the position.
Interview Questions: What are your time availabilities

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a one-time general getting to know you interview in person. I was asked situational easy questions about how I would respond/react to situations that could occur at the front desk.
Interview Questions: What to do if a security threat occurred

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for Berkeley SkyDeck (part of UC Berkeley) and was called to interview personally. Honestly, this was one of the smoother interview processes I have had but the reason it's negative is my experience with the HR department. I had been selected for the position with a start date and was over the moon until I was told by the UC Berkeley  HR that they do not sponsor employees. A lot of companies don't and that is okay, but for me to have gone through the entire process and then have this thrown at my face nonchalantly was very upsetting. What's more, I had to personally contact the senior HR person because the person I was talking to had absolutely no idea about anything. When you mention in your job post that you are an EOE did you not expect such applications? The lack of information, miscommunication and a completely apathetic response from the HR is what really upset me. What's more, I was told to 'withdraw' the application instead of them accepting that it's they who cannot employ me. I had mentioned more than once that I was an international student, yet I had to wait until the very last moment for all of this to unfurl.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you with HTML and Wordpress?

title: Student Associate Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: A laid back interview that discussed future plans and asked what I was looking for to see if it was a match. A one on one with an immediate superior and that was it.
Interview Questions: Would you be open to performing a wide variety of tasks as needed with a small team?

title: Research Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The civility has gone out of everything in the past 20 years. When you are among the finalists for a job, after a second interview -- we're not talking about the hundreds of initial resumes -- they don't do you the common courtesy to send you an email saying they have selected someone else for the position. That's where we're at in 2018. The unemployment rate is low, but everyone hates their jobs, so everyone is applying for everything, and consequently it is still as much of a buyer's market for labor as ever in the darkest hours of the financial crisis. Regrettably, the way Berkeley is run seems as corrupt as any other organization out there. Yet people will always clamor for that prestige. For average administrative positions at UCB, the problem is that you are living in poverty in the Bay Area on a salary at the median US income. Couldn't square all these elements.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience.

title: Decal Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: They will text you where to meet them. There will be 4 to 5 former or current Taiwnese instructors. They will asked you some very basic questions. You just relax and answer the questions confidently.
Interview Questions: What do you want this job?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Heard back a few weeks after applying. 30 minute phone interview with several financial analysts as well as the manager.  About two weeks later: in person interview with 6 panel members, all of whom were upper level managers
Interview Questions: Most of the interview was just getting to know me. All panelists had the same list of questions they read from. Most were just professional work environment situational questions, they also asked a little about previous finance experience.

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy over the phone interview scheduled at your leisure. Takes about fifteen minutes and there is no follow up. I don't know anyone who has not gotten hired here.
Interview Questions: Convince me that candy is good for children.

title: Work Study Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Look in the work study website early in the semester. Send your resume to multiple jobs. If you are selected for an interview they will email you. Treat the interview seriously, don't think it'll be easy or that the job is in the bag because it's work study, as most times, multiple people are applying for the same job.
Interview Questions: How much work study do you have? What is your schedule for the semester?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: There were two parts to the interview. The first part had multiple panels and the second part was a group activity.  At each panel, there were two questions asked and you had five minutes total to answer both questions.
Interview Questions: How would you define social justice?

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went very smoothly for me. Aleena was super friendly and easy going which made the entire process feel casual. The entire interview took about 30min with behavioral questions since this is a customer service type of job.
Interview Questions: Describe an instance when you had to resolve a conflict.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I worked for Research Lab at Berkeley. They basically ask your background and project experience. No coding challenge or related questions regarding Computer Science. You will literally get the position as you apply for since I've seen lots of students who just got the position and literally did nothing.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director (A Position Within the Student Union) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley in May 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Almost 3 months after I applied, I was called for a phone interview. There were about 6 people on the half-hour call. Next, I was invited to an all-day interview consisting of 5 panels plus a lunch. I met about 20 people overall. I felt it went well. 

But they never got back to me to let me know their decision. After a full day of interviews? UNPROFESSIONAL AND UNCONSCIONABLE. I reached out to HR after a month (!), and heard nothing in response. Eventually I went to the program website and saw the new director's name listed on the website. It was the same person who was serving as the interim director. I'm sure I never even had a chance at this role, and that they only interviewed external candidates as a matter of procedure. 

I am a UCB alum and had a favorable opinion of the university, but this has left an extremely sour taste in my mouth.
Interview Questions:
Main questions for the phone interview: 
1.	Recent experience, what you’d bring to the job
2.	Question about youth leadership philosophy
3.	Strategy when supervising or coaching students 
4.	Strategic planning experience
5.	Grant writing experience

title: Undergraduate Student Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Asked questions about previous teaching experience, aspects of the class, as well as behavioral. Had to teach one concept relevant to the class on a whiteboard for a few minutes, and then explain the faults in teaching you coudl improve.
Interview Questions: Choose a topic and "teach" it for 5 minutes.

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy and flexible. The projects were clearly described and flexibility on the start day. Overall the onboarding process was quite helpful. There are a lot of networking events and mentorship programs.
Interview Questions: Tell me about the research?

title: Graduate Student Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application with 3 short essays, along with my CV. After getting through the initial round, I went to an in person interview with the directors of the program. The interview was about 20 mins in which they asked some questions about my interest in teaching for the program and being part of the fellowship. I talked about my history with students, dealing with crisis situations, and interest in student mentorship. They asked more questions to probe about this.
Interview Questions: How would I assist a distressed student?

title: Events Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Was brought in for an in person interview as the first round and that was the only round. It was with three other people working there who eventually were my managers. It was really more of a personal interview to see if you would have great customer service and be a good fit. Nothing was really tricky or technical.
Interview Questions: If I knew about AV technology

title: Senior Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: This was a few years ago and not during COVID. Roundtable interview process and was not too challenging. Asked many questions about a wide variety of topics and got to meet various professional staff. Smooth process and lasted about an hour.
Interview Questions: Describe your strategies for time management.

title: Contractor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied several months ago and was contacted by the hiring manager 5 weeks later. We had a pleasant telephone conversation followed by an interview a few weeks later.  The process was proceeding: reference check and then a verbal job offer.  Due to internal processes, even though a verbal offer was extended to me from the hiring manager and I accepted it,  this never proceeded to a written job offer.  Frustrating delays and no response from HR to my inquiries led me to believe this would fall apart.  As a contractor I could no longer wait as I lost confidence that HR would come back with the required paperwork.  After a 2nd due date passed, a former boss reached out to me with a limited short term assignment that I accepted.  I do not place blame on the hiring dept, these delays are 100% due to mismanagement throughout the HR team.

Advice:
Be honest
Be transparent and take responsibility
Train your staff
HR staff- don't lie to the hiring manager on why I couldn't hang on and wait for you to get your act together
Interview Questions: Explain a process you implemented, what was the end result?

title: Academic Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Oakland, CA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received a phone call a month later to schedule an in-person interview for the following week. Lengthy interview with 16 questions, which took about an hour total. Received a phone call from the hiring manager two days later that they selected another candidate that possessed more relevant experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you took initiative.

title: Staff Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the website. I was called for interview after one and half month. There were two rounds of interviews of which one was with the Director of the facility.  The third one was a laboratory work, where they examined my pipetting skill.  During the interview, they asked some ten questions which included basics in molecular biology and sequencing.  The environment was very optimistic and they answered my queries in the best way. I enjoyed the entire process. They send me the offer letter within few weeks and I have accepted it.
Interview Questions: Explain the workflow of Illumina NGS platform.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: This was a one on one interview in which the interview asked me a series of behavioral and situational questions. There was an online application with written answers and an in person interview.
Interview Questions: How would your references describe you?

title: Equipment Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Met with direct manager, and director. Was asked questions about past experiences. Was given quite a few technical questions. Hypothetical situations where certain tools showed certain malfunctions - and what I would do to investigate and or repair.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Most interviews at UCB are a panel interview, where there are 3-6 people at the table. They ask a set of questions and are required to ask the same questions to each candidate.  Sometimes they do a phone screen first, and expect to hear some of those exact questions if you make it to a personal interview.  Good idea to wear blue and gold to the interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position and why do you think you are qualified?

title: Center Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview which led to a panel interview with a written portion. Interview panel was 20 minutes late, interviewer was texting during the interview.  Drilling going on outside, no one offered water to drink, yet they had it for themselves.
Interview Questions: if I had experience working with Unions.

title: Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasted almost a half an hour but felt like it went by quick. There were 3 people on the panel which was kind of intimidating as a student, but they were friendly. They just asked questions related to the job and they really liked that I had journalism experience.
Interview Questions: They asked about organization and time management I believe.

title: Parking Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: 1 on 1 interview with senior member about how you helped a customer or demonstrated leadership qualities. Dress semi formal and expect the interview to last 30-45 min. the entire process took around 2-3 weeks so apply in advance
Interview Questions: Asked brief questions about times you helped a customer

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed at a microbiology lab and was surrounded by 3 post-docs, 1 grad-student, and the principal investigator. They asked very specific questions about their lab and general biology related stuff.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in microbiology?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty straight forward.  I got a very good impression of the department of the bat. The people were friendly. I was a bit nervous.
Interview Questions: Why are you a applying to this position?

title: Staff Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: I got refer from a friend and the process took about 2-3 weeks.  The interview was smooth and chill. Just be prepared to explain your research experience and how you tackle technical problems.
Interview Questions: Some Technical questions about research

title: Admissions Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer set up an interview through an online school application portal, we had a one face-to-face interview, there were very easy questions and amicable environment set up for the interviewee. Quick, reliable responses in an amicable environment and quiet setting.
Interview Questions: What do you think you can learn from working here?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Not much of a process, they asked about my availability and student eligibility.  I talked with the supervisor of the facility, after I told him I was interested he said he would get back to me within a week
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience working with FACS?

title: Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Took forever, and then moved very fast with 2 interviews and offer within 4 days. I waited a very long time, heard nothing, had almost forgotten I was in the running and suddenly got a call one day. Was very surprised and excited.
Interview Questions: Panel interview. Lots of role play like questions. Lots of questions about how I deal with inefficiency, bureacracy , dysfunction and chaos.

title: CAD Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (San Francisco, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: You come in sit talk with manager and his assistant. It was kind of off putting the questions but not something you couldn't answer immediately. Its interesting I didn't really feel good about the job as they require a lot of Grad Students and they want a 2 year commitment. Which I find strange like you can't get any experience in other firms just work for them all year long its that good of a deal.
Interview Questions: What are your goals?

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions:
I had 2 really great interviews, followed up multiple times, and they ghosted me.

Sad that an industry so theoretically focused on “changing & connecting the world” doesn’t have the basic decency to simply follow up.

People talk to each other- be mindful of the impact your ghosting may have. A candidate is a candidate, and you should treat them as a professional, not like some random girl/ guy you met online.

Advice to recruiters & hiring manager:

Respond to your candidate’s emails, and try to be as honest and transparent as you can about timelines. We all understand that things come up, emails don’t get sent, etc. Your candidate shouldn’t have to follow up with you post-interview (that is your job, not theirs).
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Presentation for an hour followed by discussion with the PI and lab members for the whole day. Subject related questions mostly, then followed by culture fit for the particular lab you are interviewing for
Interview Questions: What is the reason for selecting this particular field?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: In person face to face interview, felt more like a personality screening than technical screening. No technical questions, no coding interview, just basic questions about academic interests and previous experiences.
Interview Questions: What similar experiences do you have?

title: Transportation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (UC Berkeley, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen. Helpful and Friendly Panel Interview. One-on-one interview thereafter. The process went smoothly because the atmosphere allows you to be free and open with discussions, your paradigm, and your approach to problem solving.
Interview Questions: Do you prefer to be a day-to-day operations manager, or a strategic planner.

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a quick process - took less than a month. I applied online but I had a friend talk up my resume to HR. The interview itself was with a host of program directors. Later on, I found it odd that I never had a chance to chat with my colleague with the same title who had been there for years in the role.
Interview Questions: What are your associations with unions and collective bargaining.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very brief interview. Asked common questions on data structures and algorithms. Even if you've done leetcode right, the interview would be pretty hard for you. The interviewer was rough and outrightly started commenting on how bad my code is.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for UC Berkeley?

title: Research Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions:
2 rounds. One phone and one on-site.
Phone interview mainly asks questions based on the resume and some behavior questions.
The on-site one is more high-level. Most of the questions focus on the real work experience.
Interview Questions: Give an example of how you deal with a large data set.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Started with a brief presentation of introduction and previous projects. Asked about some previous research experiences and intern experiences, specifically the role and contributions made in projects. Also talked about interests in research directions.
Interview Questions: Q: what is the potential application of a certain kind of materials?

title: ASUC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Professional but welcoming. Very straightforward interview questions and they seemed like they really wanted to get to know me. It was just me and two supervisors interviewing me. They took turns asking questions and it was a pleasant experience. They were very honest about the position.
Interview Questions: Biggest strength

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an online application including my undergraduate transcript, GRE scores, and two essays.  What more can I say.  It was a normal graduate application process...They want me to write 30 words though.  Isn't that a ridiculous requirement.  Sometimes there really isn't anything more to say.  And yet I am forced to fill up space.
Interview Questions: They did not ask me any questions.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions:
It was decent. There were three people interviewing me.
They asked me to introduce myself, asked me about items on my resume.
They had a sheet of questions to ask me and they took turns to ask me the questions.
Interview Questions: What were your previous experiences, why do you want this position, etc.

title: Recruitment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Met with 6 interviewers who asked standard questions they had prewritten, very basic HR, very uncreative. left the interview feeling less excited by the lack of innovation in the interview, and felt the interviewers were robotic.  

They said they'd get back to me in a week, but I had to wait a month to get any feedback after trying to contact the lead recruiter every week. I ended up being very unimpressed with the process, and felt glad I didn't move forward with a company that doesn't respect the interview process. It's clear they are unorganized and don't care about entry level employees. They can blame it on process (as a government entity) but it felt very unprofessional. I've experienced much better interviews many other places, and it's clear their process needs work.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized? how do you manage multiple projects?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview was done as a video self-interview - record yourself answering questions.  Next is a panel interview with 6 other people for an hour.  There is a coordinator that is a primary contact and sits in the interview panel.  Overall it was a well-coordinated process.
Interview Questions: General questions about work experience, what was done, how it was done, and technical questions.   Questions such as tell us about your experience in financial systems, software, tell us a time when something didn't turn out as expected, mistakes encountered and so forth.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume and cover letter through the UC Berkeley jobs website. The first time I tried to submit the application, it didn't go through. I knew it didn't go through b/c I got a confirmation e-mail that said "We got your application for the following position..." and then the rest of the e-mail body was blank. The second time I submitted my application, I submitted it successfully. I got an e-mail the next week asking for a phone interview.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me a bit about yourself and why you applied for this position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very brief, the interview was almost as if they needed someone so they didn’t care who they hired as long as they could do simpler tasks. I also felt that it was rushed.
Interview Questions: What makes you a strong candidate?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (San Francisco, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: First is a small code question: Create a dictionary of every word in a text file and then create a matrix based on the text file. After 2 weeks, have an interview with professor on skype. Asks about my background and the projects I did. Also, the weekly work load. Get offer after a week.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your project.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions:
Went through a 30 minutes phone interview. The interviewer was friendly, she asked some questions about my work experience,and what I knew about the job scope and the study involved. 

The general job scope was posted online but not the specifics about the study, it was useful to read up on previously published journals to ease this process. The bulk of the interview involved me predominately asking her about specifics about the study and what it entails.
Interview Questions: Please describe your background. What are your previous experience in research and coordination.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Hartford, CT) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was 17 questions, they said it was Berkeley policy. All the interviewers were super nice but there were 3 which made me a little intimidated. I applied on skype and half way through the connection cut out, but they had given me a number before so I could call if something like that were to happen. We then continued the interview on the phone. Overall it was pretty relaxed, they do ask you why you are interested in the specific department of study you are applying for even if you have an administrative job, so be careful of that.
Interview Questions: How would you plan an event from start to finish?

title: Project Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (UC Berkeley, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: 30 mins phone screening with HR, followed by a 1.5 hour panel interview on site. HR was very difficult to communicate with during this process, did not follow up very well and were not easy to reach. The interview itself went fine, although I had been informed if they'd asked me back for a second interview, it would have been another 1.5 hours with a different panel. To me, this seems like a large waste of the interviewee's time, the first interview could be a bit shorter, down to the normal 1 hr time, and then anyone who was going further along could come back for a longer, second interview.
Interview Questions: What ideas do you have for how to measure successful project outcomes?

title: Admissions Reader Haas School of Business Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: First I spoke with someone currently doing the job. Then I went into the office to be interviewed by the position manager. We discussed my background, the position and the school, then discussed some approaches to doing the job.
Interview Questions: How would you describe the culture of Haas? How would you identify candidates who would best fit the culture?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was simple, but it took them a while to get back to me. I submitted an application two months before they reached out to me for an interview. There was a panel of interviewers who asked to see your resume and asked basic interview questions. Questions included your hours availability, strengths and weaknesses, mostly behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? What past experience did you have that made you qualified for the job?

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: as a full time student in uc berkeley, I have taken this class already. Since I got a good grade in the class in previous semester, I am qualified to apply for the grader job for the same class. Hence there is not a required interview process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Writer/Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was asked via email to provide 2-3 writing samples, then invited in to speak in person with the communications director and the assistant director. We talked for about an hour, and a few days later I returned for an hour-long group interview with a couple of additional communications staff members as well as an academic researcher/director.
Interview Questions: What specific subject areas I had experience writing about. What audiences I had the most experience writing for; how I'd feel about writing for a different set of audiences.

title: Statistical Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The professor will ask you whether you have certain experience of statistics. If you have then you can be as consultant It is a very good experience I like it so much
Interview Questions: Have you learned regression before

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (UC Berkeley, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I got this interview through a referral and was one of the only people who applied. The interview went really well and I just talked about myself and previous experience. At the end of the interview the person told me I would most likely be hired.
Interview Questions: Favorite Marketing Campaign?

title: QA Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: First applied through the website, then talked to the student lead of the team. He showed me around before asking me some interview questions. Most were standard (strengths, weaknesses, etc) and a few practical questions that were fairly simple (since the job claimed no experience was necessary).
Interview Questions: Given some specifications of a software, point out how specs were unclear and how they could be improved

title: Student Services Advisor -- Goldman School of Public Policy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Applied for the position in early November.  Received a request for a phone interview via email the week before Christmas. Had 30 minute phone screen with hiring manager and was asked if I was available later that day or the following Monday.  Was told that I would hear from her either way before the end of the day.  Did not hear anything.  Followed up via email thanking hiring manager for the opportunity, etc.  Holidays come and go, and I receive an auto-generated email stating that I am no longer being considered for the position.

So the doozy is that I am an alumnus of this program and the hiring manager treated me disrespectfully.  Of course I am disappointed that I did not move on but I expect that I once I have talked to the hiring manager that I would receive a personalized email saying that I am no longer being considered.
Interview Questions: Where do you expect to me in 5 years?

title: Crowdfunding Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The first interview was over the phone with the hiring manager. It lasted about 30 minutes and I was asked questions about my work history and education. The second interview was over the phone with their crowdfunding consultant. He was very knowledgable and asked a lot of great challenging questions.  

The 3nd and final interview was a panel interview with 4 people from the department. They have a list of 9 questions. In the spirit of fairness, they told me that they could not veer from the provided questions. 

While I didn't get offered the position, it was a very positive experience. The folks at Berkeley were very accommodating throughout the process.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with crowdfunding?

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: There were four interviewers who asked about 3 questions each. Total interview lasted about 1 hour, including time for me to ask a few questions at the end. The overall interview was pleasant and not intimidating at all.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my experience in all the areas specifically listed in the job description.

title: Human Resources Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial phone interview with a couple of the recruiters and then an in person panel interview. I felt like a couple of them were rather unfriendly and actually quite condescending which surprised me because they had seemed nice over the phone. I did not get offered the position but I'm actually not sure I would have accepted if they had. I was excited to get this interview but they did not make it feel or sound like a place I would want to work.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a recruiter gave you a list of interviews to schedule by tomorrow with no dates or details.

title: Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: After an initial phone interview, I met with the entire team on the same day.  Great interactions and conversations, and I got a sense of the job expectations and culture of the department.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you needed to handle multiple expectations from different team members.  How did you prioritize your work?

title: CalPact Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed over the phone briefly to be screened.  Then brought in once for a formal sit down interview.  The interview was two hours long and I saw two managers for my interview.
Interview Questions: What is your background in teaching classes?

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview and one in person interview with two interviewers. It was pretty chilling experience since the interviewers are really nice and welcoming. I applied it online through college program for this position. A week later, I received an email saying they would like to have me for phone interview. The phone interview only took about 10 minutes. Three hours after my phone interview, I received a phone call that they want me to have an interview with me in person.
Interview Questions: 1.Describe the time when you have to face stressful situation and how you handle it?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online through Cal website, phone screen  and then a couple of in person meetings. Took 2 
months. Applied online through Cal website, phone screen  and then a couple of in person meetings. Took 2 months.
Interview Questions: Standard stuff - experience, pubs

title: Desktop Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: The interview was straight forward. I answered several questions regarding my past experience and why I deserved the position. I also provided scenarios based answers to issues that may or may not show up were I to be accepted.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you deserve this position

title: Student Veteran Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview with the Supervisor was smooth and usually the final approval. They asked a lot of questions regarding your interests and soft skills. Additionally, they ask why you want to work in this position and why you are passionate about the position. The interview process gave me an idea of how the work schedule and interaction I will have with students will be.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work and assist this particular student community?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Got invited for an interview after an informal inquiry for a position. The administrative assistant arrange travels and accommodation. She received me on the they of the interview and confirmend the interview procedure. I gave a presentation on previous work and proposed project / Q&A. Panel interview with 3 group members, followed by 1-1 with PI, followed by lab tour.
Interview Questions: Why is your work important in non-scientific terms?

title: Research Administrator III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen followed by an in-person interview with a panel of 4.  Panel interview was about 15 questions and lasted less than an hour.  Questions are very easy if familiar with functions listed on job description.  No specific technical or policy questions were asked.  Received an offer three weeks later.
Interview Questions: How would you explain to a faculty member that they cannot use a specific award for an expense that would be disallowed under contract terms?

title: Contract Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with HR, then two interviews with my department. The interviews were quite long, with lots of questions involving "tell me about a time when....". However, they were very accommodating, as I was interviewing from far away and they allowed me to do all of my interviews over skype.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you developed a new method of doing something in the office

title: Library Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Rather easy interview experience, with standard interview questions. Overall the interview process was short (about an hour), and not intimidating or uncomfortable. The interview started with meeting HR who have you read the job description and review the job title. After acknowledging the full job description and qualifications with HR, I was sent to the library where the job is located. The interview panel consisted of three library employees, which one of them was the supervisor for the position. Nothing out of the ordinary and no alarming questions or unexpected issues.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the job?

title: Graduate Student (Chemistry) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Apply to grad school, if you get in, then they pay for you to visit. Unlike MCB programs, Chemistry just accepts you. I believe that the essays are important but I would say your letters of recommendation may be more important. Also, a strong previous research experience is important. Overall, the application was a bit more difficult than other programs (ex: Columbia or Penn) but less annoying than MIT.
Interview Questions: 3 essays. Current statement, a previous research statement and a diversity statement. The diversity statement is different than other graduate schools.

title: Sustinability Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: 30-45 minute phone interview with two senior managers in the Dining Hall program. I was asked questions ranging from my experience working on teams and my preferred work environment, to how I interact with the fields of sustainability and food systems. They expected me to have done a lot of background research on their existing programs.
Interview Questions: Q: How do you stay in touch with new developments in the world of sustainable agriculture and food?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (UC Berkeley, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was taken for a tour of the lab and told which areas of the room I would be working with, mostly preparing specimens (usually in skeletal form), lab maintenance, and basic data entry work. I was asked about my student status and my current plans for the future (i.e. job, graduate school) and asked when I would be available to start.
Interview Questions: Is this work that interests you?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Smooth interview process, all communication was efficient and professional from the moment i applied online. Overall the interview process was not stressful and the job position was explained thoroughly.
