The panel interview was good as well, showed the office/work environment and all questions were answered. the whole process took about two weeks, and was a smooth process.
Interview Questions: How do you value customer service

title: Computer Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very casual with the law library IT head. She first asked some behavioral questions about dealing with potentially difficult patrons, and then moved onto technical questions. I was required to perform some basic IT functions on a Windows and Mac computer, and then showed around the office.
Interview Questions: Show me how to troubleshoot various internet connectivity problems

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an online application and was later notified of my acceptance to the program. I had spoken at length with the department and professors, and so had already established a professional relationship with them. They did not interview me.
Interview Questions: No "interview" questions were asked.

title: Security Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Quick interview--they wanted to make sure you were responsible and quick to react to unforseen problems.  Asked situational questions and realistic scenarios that you had to decide how to react.  You interview with the person who will be your Unit Coordinator--mostly she wanted to see if I would fit in with her team and get along with the rest of the group, since she said there was a lot of email interaction regarding shifts and changing shifts at the last minute.  She asked if my plans usually change frequently or if I was usually able to schedule my calendar a month in advance (which was required for this job since we schedule our shifts in month-long blocks).
Interview Questions: A student is trying to sneak a friend in without showing the friend's ID. What do you do?

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I approached a professor directly and asked to be considered for the teacher assistant position for that professor's course. The professor asked me some brief interview questions about my capacity for the content of the course and my interest in teaching.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a Graduate Student Instructor for this course?

title: Graduate Student Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Wasn't really required to interview but many people have to answer basic knowledge to demonstrate that they can explain ideas. It was way less pressure that I had expected.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to teach?

title: Scheduling Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with a set of standard questions. The interviewer brings you to a location within the Student Union to begin your interview. They were very kind and charming.
Interview Questions: What is something you look for in a team of individuals?

title: Career Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions:
Online application
Phone interview - 30 minutes with committee panel
In person interview - committee panel + 10 minute oral presentation + management interview with management staff + lunch with hiring managers + meet & greet with staff
Interview Questions: What interests you in this position?

title: Graduate Student Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Had to email professors repeatedly, got a few meetings, they were pretty casual, mainly questions about relevant work experience. Sometimes they ask for references. Works differently for different departments. Need to go prepared to convince them why you are fit for the role. Some departments just have a GSI co-ordinator who handles the whole thing, others require you to talk to professor to assess whether its a good fit.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do this job?

title: Facilities Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by email with a series of screening questions. After completing this, a recruiter called me and left a message requesting a phone interview. I called the recruiter back twice over two days, but my call was not returned. I finally was able to catch her in person when I called randomly one evening. The first question out of her mouth was whether I would agree to a lower salary, even though I had indicated my minimum salary in the email screening, and it was within the publicly posted range. Even though we continued the interview, I felt that we were stuck at the question of money.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked in environments where your supervisor was not always accessible?

title: Housing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews, a lot of people were interviewing, various candidates, various teams, extremely helpful to get to know the work and people I would be working with. I was given a lot of feedback and was given a tour as well
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with diverse students/staff/faculty

title: Campus Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: There is a paper/essay application, an audition (you're auditioning with maybe 40 other potential hires), and a final interview.  The audition is mainly to see if you can speak to a crowd.  There is a time for you to introduce yourself individually, a role-play with another interviewee, and a group task.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to work during the summer?

title: Desktop Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume and cover letter online. After a week or two, received an offer to come in and interview. Group of interviewers. Asked me about my past experience. Asked about technical skills, asking if I  had experience with various technologies. A few basic technical questions. Majority of the interview was dealing with behavioral (hypothetical situations).
Interview Questions: What is the difference between an IP address and a MAC address?

title: Staff Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed through Skype with a postdoc and the professor of the lab.   I was offered the job a few days later.  Mostly, we talked about what kind of research I had done in my masters and some details about what the position I was applying for entailed.  They asked a few standardized questions, but I got the feeling that they were looking for a general rapport with me as an assistant in their research goals.
Interview Questions: How will this job further your career goals?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The conversation was casual, the three interviewers followed a pre-written questionnaire, and took turns asking questions. The atmosphere was relaxed, and the interviewers were two supervisors and the interim director.
Interview Questions: They asked about my past experience in  UC Berkeley and what kind of experience I had had with HTML and CSS. There were no questions about designing learning experiences. They also asked about my weaknesses.

title: Principal Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by an HR person a week after submitting my application online. Set up a six-person panel interview on Wednesday with 4 designers, a developer, and a manager. All very nice and had prepared questions in advance. Got contacted Friday and asked to come in for another round of interviews now with three people: web director, executive director of marketing and external relations, and an editorial director. Also very nice people who seemed genuinely invested in their work. Was told by the executive director that they are looking to fill the position fast and will be contacting me by EOW with next steps and making an offer the following week. However, I have not heard from them by EOW or by mid next week, which was odd because they were very responsive and transparent in the process. Had to call HR to find out that I was out of the race. I was disappointed by the way they handled the situation. I thought they should have let me know either way because I already was pretty far in the process.
Interview Questions: How do you keep up with design trends?

title: Mail Room Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (UC Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Got contacted through e-mail by the supervisor in order to set up an in-person interview, conducted at I-House. Pretty informal interview, they just wanted to get to know my personality, previous experience with customer service and whether or not I could handle the mail room when it got busy. I was hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: Do you think you'll be able to handle the mail room during move-in seasons or holidays?

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: 1 hour convention interview followed by 1 day campus interview. Met with search committee all at once at convention interview. Met with various faculty members individually at campus interview. Gave research presentation of about 45 minutes, followed by 30 minute Q&A. Went to lunch with a group of graduate students. Went to dinner with a few faculty members, some of whom were on the search committee, others not.
Interview Questions: If I could teach a certain course.

title: Work Study/Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions:
I was a student and looking for a work-study job. I checked UC Berkeley's employment website and found the job. After mailing my resume, I got respond next day to set up an interview. The interview was held in one of their meeting rooms with two senior Liberians. They were intelligent and friendly. 
All interview questions were related to the particular job. No old school questions such as "what are your strength and weakness."
Interview Questions: I can't think about any.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: One interview with the library supervisor with a tour of the workplace. Questions were basic and behavioral.  Mostly just questions about past experience. She also asked about your future plans and was hoping someone that could work for 1+ years. Other than that, they'd take pretty much who ever get interviewed.
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: I found the position through workstudy.berkeley.edu and sent my resume and cover letter online.  I received a call back within a week, and was basically given a phone interview right then and there.  After the interview, the office manager (who was conducting the interview) told me to come in the next day.  One of the other employees showed me around, and before I knew it, I was sitting in the HR office filling out my paper work.  I didn't even have an actual in-person interview.  It was probably because it was just for a work study position, but it was the easiest interview I've ever had.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Student Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process begins with an online application where you indicate your course preferences. There's also space to submit or upload your CV. After submission, professors choose students based on preference. Final assignments are formalized by the GSI coordinator. There isn't a formal interview, but professors talk to one another to see who might be a good fit. First time GSI's are often assigned to a general, lower division course.
Interview Questions: You state why your background prepares you for that particular job.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Dependent on department. Application process was rigorous for bioengineering. Need research experience in undergrad or some time of summer research experience. Any prior publications are looked upon favorably. Rec letters are also very important, with research letters having higher weight than letters from a prof you just took a class with.
Interview Questions: Describe your research.

title: Student Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview in which the recruiter asks a short series of questions that put you in the situation of negotiating a donation from a stubborn alumnus, dealing with rejection, or building rapport with a Cal alumnus.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I found the listing on the UC Berkeley website- the application form was easy to complete, and I was able to submit a resume and cover letter. I heard back within the week to schedule an interview, and passed directly to an in-person interview with the hiring committee.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with Fundraising?

title: ECON C175 Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (UC Berkeley, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy process, just got an email 2 months before the start of the semester. the faculty told me that I had a good standing in GPA and the coursework. I replied with some basic information regarding my next semester and working experience as a tutor. Got an offer a week after and signed it.
Interview Questions:
Q. how much time commitment would you be able to make during the semester?
Q. what other classes or activities are you participating in?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: They had a opening posted on their website. I emailed them my resume in an email explaining why I am interested in the position. I got a interview. I met with the PI and the Post- doctorate student who I will be directly working with. They asked about my previous experience and explained what the position was.
Interview Questions: For me the hardest part was whether I can be there for the summer. I was applying for a part-time during the semester. They also asked me to not take a class and devote that time to the lab.

title: Proctor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (UC Berkeley, CA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: the interview is easy.. don't even have to dress up.. they basically call you in to discuss what you're doing at Berkeley and what you plan to do afterward.. it's more about getting to know you rather than assessing your skills for the job
Interview Questions: are you a student ?

title: Recreational Student Facilities Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Submitted job application and resume. Contacted by manager within the same day and was asked to come for a group interview. The process was easy and straightforward, and was a good practice in interviewing for a student.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself in 3 words

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: The standard method of hiring for undergraduate research assistants at Berkeley is through their CalCareer Center portal. But I would suggest a better method would be to contact directly the professor at office hours. Once they establish there is room in the lab, I had an interview/walkthrough tour of the lab with my direct boss (the post-doctorate scholar in the lab) and then another interview after with the Professor whose research I would be working on.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you over the hundreds of other students who are better suited for this position?

title: Metrics and Reporting Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The interviewers really focuses on the role's required specific skills.  They asked intelligent questions and were focused on what you can bring for the group.  

The interview started on time and was roughly about an hour. 4 people interviewed me and each one asked questions in relation to what group they represented.
Interview Questions: When asked to provide specific examples, hard to choose which scenario would best represent the question at hand.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I first emailed the researcher asking about this job. The other day I  went to the researcher's office and talk to him. After 2 days, I got an email saying that I got the job.
Interview Questions: do you know how to use stata?

title: Student Sales Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The job was to work at the Cal Athletics Department. Role was to sell the sporting tickets like football, baseball, basketball and more. Internview wasn't that bad. All students who applied can get an interview. It takes only 1 round and you need to perform. The most important thing is able to sell yourself since it's a sales job. Able to convince whoever you're talking to. It's all group interviews 2, 3 or 4 people interview with 2 high level employers at the sales office.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? What experience do you have for sales?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (San Francisco, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met with the research advisory in a one on one interview at a conference as well as several group members. We discussed research ideas and lab culture. I attended all of the group member's presentations and contributed feedback when I could. The following day, I visited the lab and discussed their research in more detail.
Interview Questions: I provided a summary of past Heracles experiences, and we discussed approaches we might take to tackle the project I would be working on

title: Security Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was pretty simple, however, they expect very serious answers out of you.  The questions are very behavioral and they expect someone who can protect the inclusive atmosphere of the residential halls.  A very open minded, positive, gun-ho "RA" attitude is what they they are looking for.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: I just need to submit the applications to the university. No interview at all. After consider my application, they give me an offer. Also, I have to submit some document like GRE, and GPA, etc.
Interview Questions: I did not get any difficult question.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: First I was asked questions about specific points on my resume and how they would apply to this job. Then I was asked what I would do in certain scenarios and how I would handle patrons. Overall the questions were not very difficult as long as you had thought about it beforehand.
Interview Questions: If helping a patron who was physically injured meant breaking specific policy of the facility, what would you do?

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (UC Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
It varies by department/unit, so experience can vary; usually a panel.
Some panelist are better at conducting interviews than other; they must ask the same questions of all candidates, whether or not they appy to you or not. Some panels can be strict and will not let you deviate from what is asked of you. Scheduled time is critical and sometimes without flexibility even if the interview is going well. Follow-up process after the interview can be lingering, depends on the department. Often you apply for a position, you are never informed of application status. Again, it depends on the hiring department.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Circulation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I found this job on the work-study website. Before the interview, I first had to finish the work-study process. After all was done, I sent my email to the supervisor. She asked for a quick interview in her office in the library. The interview was very easy, and you just need to be very polite and in a good manner. After few days, the supervisor asked me about the available working time. Then I started working in the library.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Invertebrate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Pretty chill. Just a meeting with the graduate student you will be working under. I was asked about the classes I have taken and any background I've had working with marine animals.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Marketing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of friendly interview. First submitted resume, then I was selected, and then I had the two interviews. Interviewed with assistant manager and full time manager. Both were professional and engaged. Interviews lasted around 30 minutes. Was asked a case question each time dealing with the dying print industry and how to boost revenue.
Interview Questions: They asked about their specific industry.

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a very laid back environment. They really just wanted to talk to me and work in questions about my experience and how that might lend itself to the position. It was all very natural and comfortable.
Interview Questions: What is it that you want to do after this position? How can working here help you achieve that goal?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: emailed the professor to ask to work in her lab, she replied and scheduled an interview, and went in for the interview. she asked about my previous lab experience and what i wanted to do in the lab.
Interview Questions: Previous lab experience

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Half hour phone screen with a committee and set questions. There were no surprising questions and they reflected many of the Commission on the Future of the UC Berkeley Libraries report which had been compiled by a faculty committee the previous year.  I received a request for an on site interview within a week and had the on site interview 6 weeks later.  The job posting had suggested that the position would be filled by the fall, but the timing of the interview didn't support this.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with organizational change?

title: Postdoctoral Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: After contacting directly with PI,  I was asked several questions about the research projects in the previous institute (through email). About ~2 weeks after interview, I was invited to a seminar with a small group. An offer was given after the seminar.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Contracts Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions:
Applied to their second round of job posting.  Was contacted one week later by phone.  This was a screening interview with a recruiter.  He then set up a phone interview with the director of the department.  She asked about my background and described the position.  She then asked me to come in for a panel interview and case study.  The case study was 30 minutes and tested my knowledge and background of the contractual issues.  This was followed by a four person panel interview with employees of the other contract departments and the Chief of Staff.  They had a long list of typical interview questions and took turns asking them.  The panel interview lasted about 45 minutes.  Immediately after the interview, I was contacted by the recruiter to set up another interview with director.  I believe they chose two candidates from the panel to meet with the director who would make the ultimate hiring decision.  This interview took place two days later.  I expected the interview to be more of a meeting with the director to see if she liked me and would want to work with me since the last interviews vetted my background and consisted of typical interview questions.  However, this interview was much like the panel interview and the hiring director asked around 20 interview questions with follow-up questions regarding my responses.  It was a lot more difficult than I expected.  She then took me to meet the rest of her department.  

Overall the experience was positive and the recruiting contact was very nice.  He followed-up with me after every interview to ask how it went.
Interview Questions: All questions were very typical interview questions, but due to the large amount of them it was difficult to think of a different answer for each one.

title: CSS RA III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (UC Berkeley, CA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone and Skype interviews, I applied online and the first phone call was general and brief. Basically going over my resume and interest in the job. Second interview was a group Skype interview with several specific job related questions and hypothetical senerios. The overall process took about a month which seems standard for universities.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a professor that is trying to spend grant money on something that is not allowed?

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied to an online job posting. Got a call for a phone interview approx. 2 weeks later. Phone interview was with two people who worked in department. It was a 30 minute interview and they asked me several questions about my past experience and how I would handle situations that came up. If you are well prepared it should be smooth.
Interview Questions: What is the greatest challenge facing the UC Berkeley community?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: once you get admitted to phD program, then you go talk to professors and find phD project that interests you most.  After that, you go to the payroll office to finish the paper work.
Interview Questions: you has to get very high GPA from prestigious undergrad programs, some research/job experience is a plus

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant experience, applied online, got call for interview one week later. Met with HR and got offer 1 week later. h. h. h .h. h . h . h. h . h. h . h . h . .  h
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Human Resources rep meets with department and hiring manager for an intake process meeting. Advertised on in house and various well known job sites, recruiter sourced his/her files of relevant candidates, a hiring committee screened for "yes, no, and maybe" candidates, then had panel interviews with 5 finalists, then chose 2 most likely to get hired hiring manager interviewed both and choose candidate.
Interview Questions: What was your most difficult challenge and how did you resolve it?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Manchester, NH) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: They were pretty casual, mainly questions about relevant work experience. Sometimes they ask for references. Works differently for different departments. Need to go prepared to convince them why you are fit for the role
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do this job?

title: Visiting Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: flew to california for a meeting, just went trough my cv together with my future advisor. Showed him some previous work I had done in the field. All very informal and easy.
Interview Questions: what would you like to work on during your stay here?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then a 48 hour assignment then a half day on campus interview consisted of departmental tour, meet student and staff for open panel, interview with selection committee, 1:1 with director
Interview Questions: This position requires working with alumni of the program who may have competing priorities, how do you plan on navigating working with alumni with strong personalities?

title: Temporary Senior Custodian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (UC Berkeley, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed over the phone, as I had previously worked there, and on-site interviews are only given to new employees. They asked me to talk about my past relevant work experience, then about 4 to 8 questions about janitorial work. I was informed that I would be contacted by email for further information.
Interview Questions: How would you clean a bathroom?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job on the HR website because I already knew the department, and they knew me. I had a unique set of skills that made me the best fit for the position.
Interview Questions: What is your advising philosophy?

title: Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was a two-round interview process. I met with four people for the first round and three people for the second round. They took turns going around asking me questions. The interview took about 1 hour each time.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a difficult coworker?

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: i got a phone interview after showing interest by applying online. the phone interview was brief and short to see how convincing of a person you are. then you will get group interviews in the office, and they see how you react to certain situations.
Interview Questions: how do you persuade a mom to give her children candy?

title: Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I sent in a resume and cover letter online.  The manager immediately replied and said he would be interested in scheduling a phone interview.  The interview was brief, easy and fun.  I believe the manager wanted to make sure I was sociable on the phone.  Afterward, a similar 1:1 live interview.  I later heard back that I could come to a training on "getting in the door" and other sales techniques (paid to attend training).  Once the training ended, I was brought on as a caller.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where someone wanted to give to Cal, but simply "did not have the money"?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: There are two rounds for the interview process. There are single interviews where you speak to RDs and current RAs, and then there are group interviews where RAs and RDs observe how you interact with other potential individuals for the position. It is not a matter of who talks the most, or who listens the most, it is completely arbitrary and up to the RD observing. One female RD that I observed alongside, was extremely sexist. Every male potential that interviewed received 0-1, whereas every female potential received 4-5 (out of 5). She solely stated that the males deserved such low scores because they were exercising their male authority. I was completely dumbfounded, but in my position I can't really talk back to the RD anyway.
Interview Questions: Nothing in particular, just be weary of body language, tone, courtesy, "airtime", and other nonverbal characteristics during the group interview.

title: Outreach Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Easy application process of handing in your resume online. Recruiter will call you randomly (mine was in the evening) and ask you a series of questions related to UC Berkeley, customer relations experience, and scenario questions. If you are selected to go on to the next round, you will have a group interview with about 5 other people.
Interview Questions: Would you feel comfortable asking a very low income family for a donation to UC Berkeley?

title: Project Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Panel phone interview with recruiter an 3 others- Standard behavioral questions i.e. tull us about yourself, why you are interested in the position, strengths, weaknesss, experience that makes you most qualified for the position. Previous projects you have worked on related to the position. 
In person panel of 5- Standard behavioral questions
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are a good fit for this position?

title: Undergraduate Student Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Simple email correspondence with coordinator of GSIs
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant (Reader) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took place solely online. Applicants where instructed to select a course out of those available they wanted to be a reader for, submit their transcripts, and provide rationale as to why they would be a good fit for that particular course. Additionally, an applicant was advised to provide preferences so that if their first choice class was taking by someone deemed more adequate, they still had an opportunity to participate in the program.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to be a reader? 
What makes you qualified to act as a reader for this course?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was over the phone. The questions were simple. This first interview was just another my resume, qualifications and availibity.  The second interview was in person. It was little chanalleging. Some questions were technical. Overall good experience. I was told that tons of people applied.
Interview Questions: Talk about your research experience.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions:
send emails about 3 months ago and keep sending emails every two weeks
at Mar 17th PI Emailed me  back for a Skype interview
one day later, I had a Skype interview with PI
Interview Questions: what type of research do you like to do? what did you do for your previous research? what is your expectation on the compensation?

title: Library Supervisor II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening call followed by 4 hours of interviewing on campus with numerous members of search committee. Initially met with a 4 member group, followed by meeting with approximately 10 staff/faculty members, followed by one on one with hiring manager/direct supervisor.

title: Human Resources Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Recruited through workstudy website
Interview Questions: None - simply reviewed my resume and asked questions about it

title: Program Manager, Alumni and Student Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: This was an entry level position and therefore the questions focused on my experience. My most applicable experience was my volunteer experience, so I expanded on how that would translate to the job and my love of connecting people.
Interview Questions: What do you think is the future of college reunions?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)

I chatted with the PI after interviewing with everyone in the lab and she offered me a position right away. In my case, this was a very easy process.
