title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions:
It was an on site interview. It last for one entire day.
I got to talk to several group members and gave a presentation to the group.
Got offer two days after my interview.
Interview Questions: tell me one of your favorite research project and why

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I found the job at the UC Berkeley work study listing site. Followed the instructions and process listed on the website. Submitted my resume and cover letter. Got a call for an interview about a week later. Was called into the office and spoke with the supervisor I would be working with. Interview lasted about 20 minutes and got a call back a few days later.
Interview Questions: Guide me through your resume.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (New York, NY) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Went pretty well. The interviewer was nice and professional.  I felt comfortable during the process and thought it went well. They got back to me really quickly.  I was really shocked because I know some organizations that take a while to respond back to their interviewee.
Interview Questions: What kind of fruit would i be?

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Consisted of me and the person who manages all the hirings for the libraries.  Was a very relaxed atmosphere.  The interviewer was very friendly and the process was fairly short.
Interview Questions: Do you think that you'll be able to handle your current course load while working

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online for this newly created position in early November 2013, but was not contacted for a phone screen until early February 2014.

During the 15-minute phone screen, I was asked: my reasons for applying; specific questions about my most recent positions; my experience with research, strategic planning, and admin support; how I would work with staff who have multiple conflicting deadlines; my leadership and communication style.

They contacted me the next day, informing me that they would not be moving forward with a formal interview, which likely would've been a panel interview.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with strategic planning? Considering we're a growing organization, what steps would you take to implement this plan? What is your experience with short and long-term goals?

title: Student Affairs Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions:
Interview was fairly generic - behavioral.
  
1. Initial phone screening, 
2. One-on-one meeting
3. panel interview

I was referred to the position by someone in my old department (also at Cal), so we didn't undergo the normal hiring process.  

Overall, Cal's hiring is antiquated -> they are required to open up any full-time opportunities publicly and they need to be posted for a minimum of two weeks prior to review.  Hiring is SLOW!
Interview Questions: They literally followed the behavioral interview template - I was prepared

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by in-person interview. Very friendly, moved quickly. Interviewers were not intimidating. Asked questions about background and experience.  Got a sense of what it would be like to work there.
Interview Questions: Background, education,

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Talked to the Professor I applied for later during a conference and submitted resume and CV including references  later. Visited after conference in the same area and interviewed. Professor showed not up for first appointment. Interview was mainly about scientific topics, no other stuff was considered. Funding was from my scholarship, not the Professors ones.
Interview Questions: Scientific discussion

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (UC Berkeley, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: have phone conversation with the PI, and later arrange an onsite interview with the research group and meet one on one with each person in the group to learn about their work. Overall experience was good
Interview Questions: Experience on specific techniques

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Basic graduate student application involved taking the gre and submitting transcripts. Also includes personal statement and statement of purpose. Great university for applying to a graduate program for. I would recommended it.
Interview Questions: What was your past reasearch?

title: Welder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (North Little Rock, AR) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was bad. I hated it. I didn't like it at all. If I interviewed someone, I would do a better job. I mean, come on. Really? Man oh man oh man oh man.  That is pretty much all I have to say about that.
Interview Questions: Do you like hamburgers?

title: Team Lead Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had 3 interviews with UCB prior to getting hired.  First was phone, then with hiring manager, then with the accounting team.  The phone interview was conducted by the hiring manager, then I was invited for a panel interview, which consisted of other team leads, and the third interview was done by the direct reports.
Interview Questions: How did you make a process more efficient.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: You have a single interview with 3-4 different rotating panels and then you have a group interview. I believe they all happen in the same day. The panels for the single interview usually include a current RA and a Resident Director.
Interview Questions: How have you mediated a conflict before?

title: Graduate Student Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process: they admitted me based on an application including essays, letters of recommendations, and test scores. It's highly subjective, but I'm not sure there could be a less subjective method for choosing graduate students.
Interview Questions: It's probably fairer not to have an interview, given the high levels of bias in hiring processes. On paper, they don't necessarily know your race, gender presentation, physical appearance, accent, etc.

title: Human Resources Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Fairly standard. Phone interview, scheduled interview with panel, one on one with hiring manager. Then references and background check.
Interview Questions: How my career goals tied to the university mission

title: Senior Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Applied through their portal. It took them couple of weeks to get in touch. The job, I would say, depends on the department you hired in and the project you get hired for. Interview is a round of technical review, followed by an HR. The technical interview follows a standard questionnaire format. Each question would need you to dig out an answer based on your experience. There a few direct technology related questions as well.
Interview Questions: Write the Fibonacci algorithm and steps to follow.

title: Lead Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview was about a half hour long and the interviewer asked me to go over my resume that was submitted then asked if i had any questions of her. Thankfully i have my resume memorized so this wasn't an issue, but it did make me feel as though the interviewer did not review it prior to the phone call.
Interview Questions: I have experienced the "what are your weaknesses" questions before but never in a phone interview. This caught me by surprise.

title: Front-End Engineer Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: The process consisted of a traditional in-person interview at the CET's headquarters (located at the 11th floor of the Chase Bank building outside the Berkeley BART station). Since I interviewed for the Front End, I was mainly asked design questions about how I'd improve certain features of their layouts, followed by a slightly unexpected more technical question about text formatting. Before making their decision, they followed up by making me code up a static page about showcasing a company, which also wasn't that bad. Overall the process took less than 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: How would you implement a "see more" functionality in Javascript if all you're given is a long string from the backend?

title: Administrative Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and then interviewed a few weeks later. I was called in and the interview was entirely behavioral. No difficult questions. Everyone was very friendly and I enjoyed the interview.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength? What is your biggest weakness?

title: MFE Applicant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (San Francisco, CA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: After applying, they keep on contact and are very quick to respond to any queries. About 4 weeks after applying I got invited to interview. It was a skype interview with a past student who immediately sets you at ease. Started with some standard for questions like why finance as opposed to background, asked 1 or 2 things about the resume and then straight into 2 brain teasers. One was bizarre with tigers and sheep on an island, other was a probability one. Then moved onto some portfolio management questions and stats questions. Next was black scholes, more concentrating on intuition, and then time to ask questions and a casual chat. Overall pleasant and professional.
Interview Questions: One of the Black Scholes questions that came up was about the risk neutral pricing measure which isn't impossible but, if you aren't fresh on it, was difficult to convey verbally off the cuff and unclear how much theory to go into or intuition.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Apply online and submit your resume and transcripts as well as TOEFL and GRE. No interview process. The application deadline is very early, and you must be aware of that. You'd better find some recommendation letters from a famous scientist or professors since that will be very helpful. There are number of fellowship opportunities in UCB.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions since there is no interview.

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions:
Involves just one interview, with both behavioral and technical questions, largely behavioral though. 2-3 interviewers, at least one of which is a current tutor. 

Questions:
- Why do you want to be a tutor?
- Any teaching experience? If so, why do you want to continue?
- How would you describe your teaching style?

Then there's 2 role-play sessions which involve you tutoring one of the interviewers, largely to gauge response to difficult and/or unexpected questions. After the first session you get feedback and get to incorporate it into your second "tutoring".

Done. Deadline for contacting back will be specified at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time when you faced trouble in your studies.

Role play: really depends on the tutor

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: I was initially referred by a friend for the position and given an interview after forwarding a resume through him to the manager. I interviewed directly with the manager rather than a hiring manager, basically reviewing my available hours and qualifications for the position. It was not until I accepted a verbal offer that I was required to fill out any paperwork to apply to the position and work with HR.
Interview Questions: What has your experience with CAD been?

title: Assistant Coach Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Had previous relationship with staff so interview process was them recruiting me via phone.
Interview Questions: There is a salary freeze (and you're taking a paycut to start with)

title: IT ASSISTANT Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with just the IT manager of the building. It was one-on-one, and it was a comfortable meeting. He was very nice, and he complimented me on my resume. He reassured me that I didn't need any prior experience and that he would teach me everything I needed to know. What was most important to him was that I needed to be very comfortable interacting with users on a professional and technical level. He told me directly that there were only about 5 other applicants and that not all of them would get the chance to interview with him. I thought that was very nice of him to tell me. Overall, it was a very comfortable and "easy" interview.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable interacting with people who may be upset that something is not working the way they would like?

title: Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: They sat me down in a conference room and asked me questions. The panel included the management and senior employee as well as senior management from RSSP. Over all, it was a pleasant experience. I had worked for RSSP as a student, so the questions were easy for me. I went a little early because the position was in the lawrence berkeley national lab, which can be a little hard to navigate.
Interview Questions: How would you handle multiple customers coming to the desk at once.

title: Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (UC Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
First is a phone interview where they asked some difficult questions where you had to think and respond fast. 
Second is an on-site interview with a small group of about 4-5 people. The manager gives a presentation on the company and what to expect, then interviews 1-on-1 asking some basic questions.
Interview Questions: If you had a good conversation with one of the prospects but they refuse to donate the $2000 you asked for, how would you respond?

title: Graduate Student Instructor (GSI) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions:
For my department (each one has a different process), I searched for a new GSI position each semester - and for 3 out of 4 semesters, I taught outside my department ... simply because there weren't enough jobs to go around.  

Departments would post GSI positions, often through email listservs, and students would respond to the department administration.  Again, each department is different ... but I don't recall interviewing with the professor I'd be working with, only the admin (HR) person.
Interview Questions: What's your philosophy / policy around students cheating?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (UC Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward. Simply just asked me about questions regarding my past experience.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Patrol Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I got a phone call and was invited to come in for an in-person interview; I received a job offer several days later, and started the process of background check/drug test/etc. later that week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I was already working for the department when the project I managed came up. My boss had me in mind to run the project so it was probably the easiest hiring and interview process I've ever had. I was asked if I wanted the job, I thought about it for a few days, and decided to accept the offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (UC Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, three people in the room (supervisor, two other non-objective participants from different departments).  Went around from person to person asking basic questions.  Supervisor did most of the talking (mainly about herself) once the question portion was concluded.
Interview Questions: Why Berkeley?  Why this department?  What are your strengths?  Weaknesses?  All basic questions that all interviewers seem to ask.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed and friendly. I first got referred to the position through a friend who was leaving the job. The interview entailed typical behavioral questions. It seemed that having a referral, pleasant and enthusiastic personality, and availability of approximately 10 hours/week (as an undergrad student) is enough to get hired. I never had experience in this field of work (pedestrian, bicycle, and vehicle safety and traffic).
Interview Questions: What would you do if you had to make a judgment call? For example, during data collection, it was unclear how to categorize the data, and I wasn't in the office.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I only had to submit a resume through the work study website and then I went in for the interview up to a week later. The interview was fairly brief and informal and I was notified maybe 2 days later that I had received the position.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working here?

title: Course Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (New York, NY) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very short and informal. I showed up, interviewed with human resources, and then met the professor I was working with. We struck up a conversation and talked for a while. I guess the most important part of the whole deal was seeing we "clicked," or it would have been a miserable semester for him.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict?

title: Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds of interview: first with staff, second with faculty
Interview Questions: questions about scheduling classes

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (UC Berkeley, CA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I actually interviewed for a student mentor position at Korean Department for Summer classes. The head person in charge was really kind, so nothing to worry about, but it doesn't mean you can joke around in front since she seemed like a serious person. She asked questions like how I learned my Korean, can you write, and some simple backgrounds on myself (it would be a great plus if you took Korean classes at UCB and had a good relationships with the professors. I did and was easier for me to get the job since the head in charge kinda knew me I took the class with one of the professors) I also had to write a short paragraph/ essay about myself/ my favorite activity (I don't remember the exact question, but you had a choice for sure) at the spot.
Interview Questions: Please write about yourself in Korean

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from the hiring manager inviting me to participate in the job interview. I was interviewed by a panel of managers within the departmental group. Everyone was very professional and polite. The process ran on time and lasted about an hour.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Working closely with a search firm, Berkeley structured a full day of interviews with teams of people. The day was exhausting and most likely should have been split into two days. Finalists were brought in for person interviews from around the country.
Interview Questions: What experiences do you have in driving  a complex organization's mission?

title: Building Maintenance Worker 8213c Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (South San Francisco, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I prefer a panel interview to explain my work history to. I understand that building maintenance work involves the interaction of various departments and spaces.
Interview Questions: most difficult question would be, I have some short jobs in my work history but were from companies seeking contract work.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through web portal. With most state jobs it is a lengthy process, upwards of a month. One phone interview, fairly basic. In person interview is 6 hours long, numerous meetings with various stakeholders/management/students and then a 60 minute presentation and Q&A session. Marathon day, be prepared to repeat relentlessly... and this was for an entry level position.
Interview Questions: What does diversity mean to you?

title: Academic Center Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Took a couple of weeks. Applied online, followed by an in person interview.
Interview Questions: How does student diversity affect how you would do this job?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was not a difficult interview because I think they just wanted someone to fill the position for assistant for various routine/ easy tasks. My employer only looked at my resume and asked me a few questions, then went on to describe what kind of research his lab does. Then the former lab assistant showed me around and explained what the position entails.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself and your goals.

title: Organizational Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Team interview.Went to a meeting where there were a dozen people who filled various roles on the project.  Each person in the meeting asked me a question.  Some questions were basic questions, others provided a scenario and asked how I would handle the situation.
Interview Questions: Tell us about something similar you have done in the past.

title: Student Affairs Officer II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Open search.
Interview Questions: Sorry, honestly can't remember.  The interview was not that challenging.

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: Title changed from Postdoc to scientist, no additional hiring process
Interview Questions: NA

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: After applying online I was called for an interview two weeks later. I was given a number of scenarios to which I had to present solutions. The interview also gave an opportunity to understand more about the department, tasks, my role. I was shortlisted for a final interview a week later. More scenarios were given, I also had to explain why I wanted to change careers.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: CS170 Reader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: I got an email from the professor asking if I wanted to grade papers for his class and I said sure. It was really just as simple as that, get an A the semester before and you'll get a free job offer. Overall, the job is quite a bit of fun as I can see how the students are doing and I get to review the material.
Interview Questions: Will you please be a reader for me?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: It's a typical application process of entering a graduate school. We have to prepare GRE and our statement of purpose and personal history statement. After we submit our application, we wait for two months, and then some professors that are interested in our application would schedule interviews with us. They ask questions about my past research and wether I will come to Berkeley if I get admission.
Interview Questions: What's your top choices?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Relatively smooth process. I directly asked for a TA position from the instructor prior to my first summer TA'ing.  I TA'ed for the class for three years. I was then offered the co-instructor position the following year after continued strong display of effort.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Security Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview is fairly straightforward. The job, however, is highly coveted by students. As such, it's quite competitive. To get the job, you'll need to display a sociable attitude but demonstrate that you are able to be strict when needed. As a security monitor, you are a part of the dormitory's community. You'll need to convince your interviewer that you will not only be vigilant about enforcing rules but also that you will be a positive presence in the community.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a very drunk freshman?

title: Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with panel of people working across several differing partner offices. Fairly simple, just go over past experiences and lastly situational questions pertaining to job.  In addition asked your general interview questions, why do you want to work here? What are your weaknesses?
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses ?

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: straight forward. took about 2 weeks. manager was very friendly and was open to questions. 5 questions overall. mainly focused on work experience and adaptability. overall easy process. need not to stress out about answering questions or preparing like crazy because head department is extremely friendly
Interview Questions: how would you react if a student who screams in the library

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Application including statement of purpose, personal history statement, and resume should be submitted in Dec. In the next Feb, candidates will be invited to visit the university. Interview includes individual talks with at least six professors, several seminars presented by selected professors, dinner with faculty, party in faculty's house, student housing tour...
Interview Questions: Could you talk about your research?

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: On site interview with two managers. Process took over half an hour. Supervisors were very friendly and informative. I answered their questions and asked questions that I had. Pretty good experience.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this position?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley
Interview Descriptions: One interview consisting of behavioral questions and a mock tutoring session.  The environment of the interview was very relaxed, and the interviewer allowed me to take as much time as needed to think of the answers to their questions.
Interview Questions: How will you try to promote diversity through this position?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (UC Berkeley, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of a five minute phone conversation to get to know each other and set up the in person interview. The on-site interview was very easy and was only about twenty minutes long.
Interview Questions: What would you do if an issue arrived without a supervisor around?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: They just asked me about hours, how familiar I was with the research (like classes I took that related).  They asked about my workload and how much I was involved in campus because that could have conflicting time interests.  It went alright.  They also explained what I would be doing.
Interview Questions: I didn't really feel like there was a ton, it was mostly the hours portion as I had class during that time.

title: Career Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online submitting cover letter/resume as one doc.  Received an email request for phone interview (screening) to determine fit and interest.  Spoke w/dept manager about the position; answered questions about qualifications. Scheduled panel a day later. Met w/asst dean and program coordinator.  Offered the position w/in a few days.
Interview Questions: What techniques will you use to enhance business services?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: on-line application starting in Sep of the previous year, committee review/selection in early Jan, department notification in Feb. 50 students out of thousands of applicant got offer. For those who got offer, financial support is guaranteed.
Interview Questions: previous research experience/ publication

title: Lead Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Found posting through UCB job server. Submitted an a resume and cover letter. One brief phone interview followed by one in person interview with camp director, although I know that employees who did not live in the area had just the single phone interview.
Interview Questions: The interview was basically a series of hypothetical questions about potential situations.

title: Analyst/Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Panel asked me questions about my work history and about the department that I was applying to see if I truly did my homework about this particular position and whether I was qualified. Three people asked me questions and they were all managers. Discussion lasted about an hour total and started at 8 am so that I could get to my previous job at a reasonably time. Plus they had a computerized question about a particular issue that I may run into with the people I supervise. It was a lengthy question and they gave me 10 min to read and answer it before the computer timed me out.
Interview Questions: Which of the projects on our website did you find most interesting?

title: Catering and Events Coordinator-Housing and Dining Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview went well. After that, everything went down hill. I was interviewed by a panel of 6 people. I wasn't aware that it would be a panel but, you have to be prepared for just about anything so that was fine. What I wasn't prepared for was what rude, lifeless, unengaging, less than hospitable people they were. The questions were broad and as an event planner, one always wants to drill down to the core of a detail--so when I tried to clarify the question, one of the women on the panel threw her hands up and proclaimed "perhaps I'm not making myself clear!" and shook her head. When I interviewed canditates at my last job, I went out of my way to make that person feel welcome so that I could bring out their best and hopelly get a good sense of them and their talents.. Nope! Just the opposite here. Part of me wanted to run for the hills as I knew I would never want to work with these people....ever. The professional in me knew I needed to finish the interview and then get the heck out of there.  What a shame that they were the representatives of such a fine school!
Interview Questions: The questions were unengaging and read from a piece of paper

title: BTSS II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Contact with the recruiter, panel interview, then management interview. The series of questions are a combination of HR and IT questions. You are interviewed by the people you will be working with. Once hired the on boarding process takes awhile.
Interview Questions: Why the company. Strength and weakness on certain situations both operational and technical.

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Postdoc interviews are specific to the lab to which one applies, so the experience will vary. My experience was great. I was put up at the Hotel Durant, which is very nice and fits with the quirky vibe of Berkeley. I met with my prospective PI in the morning, with various lab members throughout the day, gave a 1 hour seminar on my thesis work, and then met with my prospective PI again at the end of the day. I also got free lunch and dinner with lab members at Berkeley restaurants, which was a great opportunity to talk shop without the PI there. Overall, it was a great experience.
Interview Questions: I was asked several in depth questions about my thesis work, but that's what I was expecting, so it didn't surprise me much.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was friendly and wasn't intimidating. They asked questions regarding my experience and interests and the potential for growth. It was one-on-one and didn't go into too much detail until the second round.
Interview Questions: How would you resolve conflict in this setting?

title: WMF Junior Consultant Interview

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through UC Berkeley as a work study student. I was looking for jobs and found three student assistant positions at Berkeley Law. I applied to two and got called back for one. At first they responded and told me that they are currently reviewing the applicants. Then they took a while to respond so I emailed them back after a week and they asked me for an interview date. I came in (in professional attire) and sat down with two interviewers. They asked me about my resume, my previous jobs, a charity event I worked on and what skills I can offer them. They also asked about my time management skills and how well do I work under pressure. The interview was really good and the interviewers (one of them is my current boss) is extremely kind. I got the email after two days and I accepted the job offer.
Interview Questions: What would you do if I (the boss) gave you a task to do and another legal assistant or law professor walks in and asks you to do another task? How would you prioritize the tasks given to you if all three of us were to ask you to get it done?

title: Director Interview

title: Instructor Interview

title: Office Manager Interview

title: Graduate Student Instructor Interview

title: Facilities (Painter) Interview

title: Junior Consultant Interview

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2012

title: Intern Interview

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: These securitization trusts include government-sponsored enterprises and private entities which may offer credit enhancement features to mitigate the risk of prepayment and default associated with these mortgages. Since residential mortgages in the United States have the option to pay more than the required monthly payment (curtailment) or to pay off the loan in its entirety (prepayment), the monthly cash flow of an MBS is not known in advance, and therefore presents risk to MBS investors.
Interview Questions: why you here

title: Student Analyst Interview

title: Development Technician V Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Found this job on Craigslist and responded by sending resume by email. Immediately booked for an interview the following week where I showed up with portfolios, drawings, and samples of my work. There was a round table of the Dept. head, facilities/operations manager and the representative superintendent from the machine shop I would be working out of. Each interviewer had specific concerns which I had to respond to often at the same time. Having my physical examples on the table, I was able to occupy each person by pointing to specific visual examples of experiences and juggle the interview. At a certain level I was controlling the interview with interesting stories of work experiences. 

After about 45 minutes I was told they would get back to me, nice to meet you etc.. The next day I was contacted for a second interview and reported to the Machine Shop and met the Engineering Superintendent who started to tour me around. I had questions about procedures, techniques, protocols, materials, and such that were answered with the additional knowing look from someone who can tell you know what you are doing by the questions one asks. When I got home the job offer was waiting for me on the computer. A formal offer was sent vie e-mail the next day and with my acceptance it was a done deal.
Interview Questions: Your work looks excellent, clean, even beautiful; but are you going to be able to really get your hands dirty when I need you?

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Literacy Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was hosted in a UC Berkeley Meeting Room at the Martin Luther King Student Union building. It was a group panel as well as a group interview. There were approximately 3 to 4 interviewers and 4 to 5 interviewees. They asked typical questions regarding how one would interact in a setting with real students under different scenarios. One part of the interview also consisted of splitting into two groups to formulate and stimulate a pretend "class presentation" on how to eat healthy and discuss our reasons why our presentation would be effective or persuasive to primary or secondary school students. 

Overall, the interview was more casual than business with a focus on how you handle classroom scenarios and your communication skills with younger people. If you have past experiences with young students in the past, I would highly recommend incorporating that into any part of the interview as it really does give the interviewee the advantage over others in the group.
Interview Questions: When a conflict comes up in class, what would be your first approach at handling the situation?

title: Mailroom Clerk Interview

Interview Descriptions: First, I submitted my resume.  Then the supervisor contacted me to send two references.  After that, I got an email to schedule an interview with the supervisor and senior clerk.  About a week later, I received my letter of offering for the position.  At the interview, I felt the friendliness and welcoming attitude of the workforce.
Interview Questions: How would you react if a co-worker approached you and told you that you were not doing your job well enough?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Apr 2010

The interview included one-on-one meeting time with my prospective boss as well as casual time interacting with prospective lab mates.  Overall, the interview was intense but relatively informal.

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview

Interview Questions: Nothing more or less difficult than the usual interview questions.

title: Consultant for A Grant Proposal Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Put in my qualifications for education consultant to administer a federal grant through one of the professors at UC Berkeley for a position needing someone immediately.  Got through the first round based on my qualifications as applied to the requirements of the position.  Wrote a follow-up proposal detailing salary expectations, answering many more specific questions about the specific tasks of the position.  Gained clarification over the phone about process of selection and timing.  Was told the project was being "rescaled" and that I would hear.  Left a phone message and an email message for follow-up.  Did not hear.  Suspect the grant was altered in some way. Not sure of outcome, but learned a valuable lesson about how to spend my time and respond to cues as to seriousness of job listing.  If a prospective hirer is in a hurry to get someone, but fails to respond in a timely fashion, that may be a clue.
Interview Questions: Qualifications for the position?

title: Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applied by submitting resume and cover letter over e-mail in January (2010). Received a response about a month later saying they were impressed by my resume and wanted to schedule an interview for the coming week. The interview was done by a panel of current employees (college students like me), and was casual. Questions about both interpersonal skills and technical skills relating to the job were asked.
Interview Questions:
Write a function (pseudocode) that makes each element of a doubly linked list appear M times in the list (in any order). You are given the definition of a linked list and of a hash table (should you decide to use it):

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (UC Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: I took the chance to visit my postdoctoral supervisor while I was on holiday in San Francisco. I contacted the person beforehand via email, but never got any response. But a friend of mine told me that I should take the chance to literally knock on the door of the professor I wanted to work with and this actually worked very well. After I introduced myself we had a short conversation and at the end he offered me a postdoctoral position subject to the condition that he could raise some money for me. 6 weeks later he officially offered me the job and I accepted it.
Interview Questions: The interview was not like questions and answers. It was a scientific conversation.

title: Computer Lab Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Got an e-mail showing interest in interviewing me. I cam and was interviewed. Quesitions were mostly behavioral. There was no technical questions. The supervisor was very friendly and she gave me the time to think for answers. It was really a pleasure to have an interview with UCB. There was no pressure whatsoever.
Interview Questions: Give three words that describe you.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview started with a one hour research presentation including time for a question and answer session. Then a one on one meeting with the principal investigator for about an hour to discuss project details, funding opportunities, and your timeline. The last part of the interview consisted on one on one interviews with lab members to discuss research and their experience in the lab.
Interview Questions:
Only research related questions
Your timeline
Future plans

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: It was a quick phone call involving a brief screening. This was regarding a student job, however, so normally I think they interview in-person, one-on-one.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about your past experience

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty straightforward. I have an initial phone interview and after was scheduled for a face-to-face interview after a week. It was a panel interview consisting of the hiring manager, the incumbent and the HR representative. They asked mostly behavioural interviews. The panel was friendly and accomodating yet very professional.
Interview Questions: The questions are fairly easy. Just be prepared to do some research on the position and about the school. Bonus points if you know their defining principles.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions: Met with a professor to discuss whether or not I would be a good fit to join the group.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions: I applied, then someone contacted me by phone. I met initially with a small panel that consisted of the supervisor, another analyst of a slightly higher ranking than the position I was applying for, and another manager from a different dept. they asked about 10 questions. I then provided a writing sample.
Interview Questions: Describe a problem you had difficulty solving and the steps you took to solve it.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: Since this was an inter-departmental transfer within UC Berkeley, the recruiting HR deparment was respectful of privacy concerns.  I was provided bios of key penalists in advance of each round of interview.  The entire process, from initial contact to panel interview, was performed promptly and in a friendly and professional manner.  I was free to ask as many questions of individual penalist as they were of me.  However, I do not expect this experience to repeat itself in any other department on campus.
Interview Questions: Difference between revenue recorded and accounts receivable

title: Security Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Mar 2008
Interview Descriptions: 1 hour interview on safety and security of the college campus in relation to the Berkeley urban environment.
Interview Questions: What are the most prevalent security threats that exist for the campus residential facilities?

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: There was a group informational session then a 1-1 interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you're a good fit?

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of California Berkeley (Berkeley, CA) in Feb 2007
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume and filled out online application. Also needed three references and GRE scores.  On site I had the opportunity to ask questions of Professors and they got to know more about my qualifications.
Interview Questions: How have you worked effectively in a team before?
